revised_title: Ray Tracing and Signal Intensity in Inhomogeneous Media
tldr: The author extends the technique of ray tracing to study the variation of signal intensity along a ray due to the divergence or convergence of neighboring rays in a ray pencil. The study focuses on plane stratification and applies the results to an anisotropic collisionless ionosphere. The signal intensity is found to be bounded and continuous, but there are singularities in some of the quantities used to calculate it.
